Armor.Name: Adverse Environmental Gear
Armor.Description: [H3]Adverse Environmental Gear[h3] Please see page 169 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 184 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 178 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.

Armor.Name: Armored Clothing
Armor.Description: [H3]Armored Clothing[h3] Please see page 169 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 184 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 178 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.

Armor.Name: Armored Robes
Armor.Description: [H3]Armored Robes[h3] Please see page 179 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook for details.

Armor.Name: Concealing Robes
Armor.Description: [H3]Concealing Robes[h3] Please see page 179 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Add [SETBACK] to checks to notice or recognize an individual wearing concealing robes.

Armor.Name: Heavy Battle Armor
Armor.Description: [H3]Heavy Battle Armor[h3] Please see page 170 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, or page 184 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, for details.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Armor.Name: Heavy Clothing
Armor.Description: [H3]Heavy Clothing[h3] Please see page 169 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 185 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 180 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook for details.

Armor.Name: Laminate
Armor.Description: [H3]Laminate (Stormtrooper Armor)[h3] Please see page 169 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, or page 185 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, for details.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Armor.Name: Personal Deflector Shield
Armor.Description: [H3]Personal Deflector Shield[h3] Please see page 170 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, or page 185 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, for details.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Armor.Name: Padded Armor
Armor.Description: [H3]Padded Armor[h3] Please see page 169 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 185 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 180 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook for details.

Armor.Name: Enviro-suit
Armor.Description: [H3]Enviro-suit[h3] Please see page 44 of the Enter the Unknown Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Suffer [SETBACK] to any Agility- or Perception-based checks

Armor.Name: A/KT Shockrider Crash Suit
Armor.Description: [H3]A/KT Shockrider Crash Suit[h3] Please see page 45 of the Enter the Unknown Sourcebook, or page 42 of the Stay on Target Sourcebook, for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Reduces strain received from Critical Hits to the wearer's vehicle by 1 (min 1).
Reduce damage from fires and weapons with the Burn quality by 1.

Armor.Name: A/KT Tracker Utility Vest
Armor.Description: [H3]A/KT Tracker Utility Vest[h3] Please see page 45 of the Enter the Unknown Sourcebook for details.

Armor.Name: A/KT Mountaineer Armor
Armor.Description: [H3]A/KT Mountaineer Armor[h3] Please see page 45 of the Enter the Unknown Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Grants [BOOST][BOOST] to all Athletics skill checks made to climb or rappel

Armor.Name: Catch Vest
Armor.Description: [H3]Catch Vest[h3] Please see page 99 of the Suns of Fortune Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Has soak value of 2 against all energy-based weapons

Armor.Name: Nomad Greatcoat
Armor.Description: [H3]Nomad Greatcoat[h3] Please see page 99 of the Suns of Fortune Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Reduces difficulty of Resilience checks made to resist the effects of extreme cold by 1
Removes [SETBACK] added to checks due to extreme cold

Armor.Name: Type III "Berethron" Personal Modular Armor
Armor.Description: [H3]Type III "Berethron" Personal Modular Armor[h3] Please see page 99 of the Suns of Fortune Sourcebook for details.

Armor.Name: TX-3 Combat Flight Suit
Armor.Description: [H3]TX-3 Combat Flight Suit[h3] Please see page 99 of the Suns of Fortune Sourcebook for details.

Armor.Name: Beast-Hide Armor
Armor.Description: [H3]Beast-Hide Armor[h3] Please see page 49 of the Dangerous Covenants Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Add [ADVANTAGE] to Coercion checks and [THREAT] to Charm checks.

Armor.Name: "Storm" Charge Suit
Armor.Description: [H3]"Storm" Charge Suit[h3] Please see page 50 of the Dangerous Covenants Sourcebook for details.

Armor.Name: Mk. III Flak Vest
Armor.Description: [H3]Mk. III Flak Vest[h3] Please see page 49 of the Dangerous Covenants Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Add +1 Soak against damage from the Blast quality.

Armor.Name: Protector 1 Combat Armor
Armor.Description: [H3]Protector 1 Combat Armor[h3] Please see page 49 of the Dangerous Covenants Sourcebook for details.

Armor.Name: "Steelskin" Anti-Concussive Armor
Armor.Description: [H3]"Steelskin" Anti-Concussive Armor[h3] Please see page 49 of the Dangerous Covenants Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Add [SETBACK] to all Brawn- and Agility-based checks. Reduce the duration of disoriented or staggered condition by 1 round.

Armor.Name: PX-11 "Battlement" Powered Armor
Armor.Description: [H3]PX-11 "Battlement" Powered Armor[h3] Please see page 51 of the Dangerous Covenants Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Remove [SETBACK][SETBACK] from Perception, Vigilance, and combat checks imposed by darkness, smoke, or similar environmental factors that obscure vision.

Armor.Name: Tailored Armored Jacket
Armor.Description: [H3]Tailored Armored Jacket[h3] Please see page 44 of the Far Horizons Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Add [ADVANTAGE] to any successful Charm, Deception, or Negotation checks.

Armor.Name: Reinforced Environment Gear
Armor.Description: [H3]Reinforced Environment Gear[h3] Please see page 44 of the Far Horizons Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Removes [SETBACK] imposed by environmental conditions.
Add [BOOST] to Resilience checks to resist toxic atmospheres or airborne toxins.

Armor.Name: Mk.IV Riot Armor
Armor.Description: [H3]Mk.IV Riot Armor[h3] Please see page 44 of the Far Horizons Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Built-in breath mask
Reduce duration of disoriented or staggered results by one round (minimum of one round).

Armor.Name: A/KT Wing Commander Armored Flight Suit
Armor.Description: [H3]A/KT Wing Commander Armored Flight Suit[h3] Please see page 42 of the Stay on Target Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Reduces strain received from Critical Hits to the wearer's vehicle by 1 (min 1).
Reduce damage from fires and weapons with the Burn quality by 1.

Armor.Name: Caballerin-Series Riding Tack
Armor.Description: [H3]Caballerin-Series Riding Tack[h3] Please see page 42 of the Stay on Target Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: May only be worn by a beast.
May ride a beast without suffering bareback penalty.

Armor.Name: Capari-Series Padded Beast Armor
Armor.Description: [H3]Capari-Series Padded Beast Armor[h3] Please see page 43 of the Stay on Target Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: May only be worn by a beast.
May ride a beast without suffering bareback penalty.

Armor.Name: Destri-Series Laminated Beast Armor
Armor.Description: [H3]Destri-Series Laminated Beast Armor[h3] Please see page 43 of the Stay on Target Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: May only be worn by a beast.
May ride a beast without suffering bareback penalty.

Armor.Name: H-Series Megafauna Carriage
Armor.Description: [H3]H-Series Megafauna Carriage[h3] Please see page 43 of the Stay on Target Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: May only be worn by a beast.
May ride a beast without suffering bareback penalty.

Armor.Name: Hutt Shell Armor
Armor.Description: [H3]Hutt Shell Armor[h3] Please see page 104 of the Lords of Nal Hutta Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: May only be worn by a Hutt.
Allows wearer to hover up to five meters above the ground.
Allows wearer to ignore the affects of Awkward and Ponderous abilities.
Does not have to spend additional maneuvers when navigating difficult terrain.

Armor.Name: Sakiyan Shadowsuit
Armor.Description: [H3]Sakiyan Shadowsuit[h3] Please see page 105 of the Lords of Nal Hutta Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Grants [BOOST][BOOST] to Stealth checks.

Armor.Name: Blast Vest
Armor.Description: [H3]Blast Vest[h3] Please see page 47 of the Fly Casual Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Armor gains +2 soak when wearer suffers damage from a slugthrower or other physical projectile.

Armor.Name: Mimetic Suit
Armor.Description: [H3]Mimetic Suit[h3] Please see page 47 of the Fly Casual Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Upgrade the ability of Stealth checks twice while suit is active.

Armor.Name: Smuggler's Trenchcoat
Armor.Description: [H3]Smuggler's Trenchcoat[h3] Please see page 47 of the Fly Casual Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Checks to find anything hidden within a smuggler's trenchcoat are opposed by the Skulduggery of the wearer.
The coat can conceal up to 2 encumbrance worth of items.

Armor.Name: Banal Apparel
Armor.Description: [H3]Banal Apparel[h3] Please see page 47 of the Desperate Allies Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Opposing characters upgrade the difficulty of checks to identify wearer once.

Armor.Name: Cargo Apparel
Armor.Description: [H3]Cargo Apparel[h3] Please see page 47 of the Desperate Allies Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Can carry three items of enumbrance 1 without it affecting encumbrance value.

Armor.Name: Diplomat's Robes
Armor.Description: [H3]Diplomat's Robes[h3] Please see page 47 of the Desperate Allies Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Add [BOOST] to social checks claiming diplomatic authority, accessing classified data, and bypassing normal protocol.

Armor.Name: Flare Jacket
Armor.Description: [H3]Flare Jacket[h3] Please see page 48 of the Desperate Allies Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Once per encounter, can trigger flare charge. Everyone in short range makes [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Vigilance check[b]. Fail means staggered for 1 round, plus 1 round per [TH][TH][TH].

Armor.Name: Hauling Harness
Armor.Description: [H3]Hauling Harness[h3] Please see page 48 of the Desperate Allies Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Upgrade difficulty of combat checks twice.

Armor.Name: Holographic Costume
Armor.Description: [H3]Holographic Costume[h3] Please see page 48 of the Desperate Allies Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: [B]Easy ([DI]) Computers check to record new garment, [B]Daunting ([DI][DI][DI][DI]) Computers check[b] to record facsimile of garment.

Armor.Name: Lector's Outfit
Armor.Description: [H3]Lector's Outfit[h3] Please see page 48 of the Desperate Allies Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Add [BO] to social checks involving large groups of listeners.
Can be heard clearly at considerable range.

Armor.Name: Noble Regalia
Armor.Description: [H3]Noble Regalia[h3] Please see page 49 of the Desperate Allies Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Downgrade difficulty of social checks to interact with nobility or subordinates once.

Armor.Name: Performer's Attire
Armor.Description: [H3]Performer's Attire[h3] Please see page 49 of the Desperate Allies Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Add [BO] to checks to perform or attract attention.

Armor.Name: Powered Capacitive Armor
Armor.Description: [H3]Powered Capacitive Armor[h3] Please see page 49 of the Desperate Allies Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: As maneuver, power up and add +1 defense and +1 soak, but lose free maneuver.

Armor.Name: Resplendent Robes
Armor.Description: [H3]Resplendent Robes[h3] Please see page 49 of the Desperate Allies Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: If wearer draws attention to himself, allies in medium range add [BO] to Perception, Skulduggery, and Stealth checks.

Armor.Name: Second Skin Armor
Armor.Description: [H3]Second Skin Armor[h3] Please see page 49 of the Desperate Allies Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Add [SE][SE] to Perception checks to notice second skin armor on the wearer.
